title: Skin Classifications

embed.description: Champion skin (or just skin ) refers to the color scheme or appearance of a champion. In League of Legends, most skins can be bought from the Riot Store with Riot Points, while others are or were available only from special events or promotions.

body:
Hey guys, 

I was wondering if any one can help me with understanding the skins mainly for what is included in the Worlds & Esports area. I'm mainly wondering what skins are included in this one for September:
http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/community/community-events/cosplayers-start-your-sewing-machines.

The site that I linked goes through but when I click on for example Championship Riven, it shows all the skins, so would all the skins count?
As well as Challenger Ahri, is that just her classic skin or would Foxfire Ahri be included in this as well?

Thanks guys for your help with this :).

replies.body:
Esports-related skins consist of :

- World Championship Commemorative skins (SSW, TPA, etc). 
- Championship skins (Shyvana, Thresh Riven*).
- Challenger (the antithesis of Championship, Ahri).

\* Riven is limited, not legacy like the other skins mentioned above. 

Championship skins, as well as commemorative skins have historically been available around the time of Worlds. Challenger Ahri was first released at the start of the 2015 season, but since she's legacy, it means she'll periodically make her way back to the store, too.
And Frozen Ezreal isn't, for some reason, a Chroma Skin. Or priced like one.
